title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 454.3 - Ground surface correction factors
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 454.3 - Ground surface correction factors

State Regulations
(a) Highway operations. When measurements are made in accordance with Part 452 of
this Title upon a test site which is "hard", a correction factor of two dB(A)
shall be subtracted from the maximum observed sound level reading generated by
the motor vehicle to determine whether the motor vehicle conforms to the sound
level limits set forth in section 386(3)(a) of the New York State Vehicle and

Traffic Law. (b) Stationary test. When measurements are made in accordance with Part 453 of this Title upon a
test site which is "soft", a correction factor of two dB(A) shall be added to
the numerical average of the recorded maximum observed sound level readings
generated by the motor vehicle to determine whether the motor vehicle conforms
to the sound level limits set forth in section 386(3)(b) of the New York State

Vehicle and Traffic Law. [FN2] Table 1 in §
450.3
of this Title is a tabulation
of the maximum allowable sound level readings, taking into account both the
distance correction factors contained in §
454.2
of this Title and the ground
surface correction factors contained in §
454.3
of this
